doc.title: <xsl:import>

value.content:
XSLT/XPath Reference: XSLT elements, EXSLT functions, XPath functions, XPath axes

The <xsl:import> element is a top-level element that serves to import the contents of one stylesheet into another stylesheet. Generally speaking, the contents of the imported stylesheet have a lower import precedence than that of the importing stylesheet. This is in contrast to <xsl:include> where the contents of the included stylesheet have exactly the same precedence as the contents of the including stylesheet.

value.title: Syntax
value.content: <xsl:import href=URI />

value.title: Required Attributes
value.content:
href

Specifies the URI of the stylesheet to import.

value.title: Type
value.content: Top-level, must appear before any other child of <xsl:stylesheet> or <xsl:transform> in the importing stylesheet.

value.title: Gecko support
value.content: Mostly supported with a few issues with top level variables and parameters as of Mozilla 1.0.

doc.pageTitle: <xsl:import> - XSLT: Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations | MDN
